anxiety.question: When you think of the word stress, what is the first word that comes to your mind?

answers.description: Your main source of stress comes from a sense of responsibility.
answers.suggestion: Set clear boundaries between your obligations and your rest time.

answers.description: Your anxiety often comes from social situations.
answers.suggestion: Work on gradually exposing yourself to social interactions.

answers.description: You are afraid of making mistakes and being judged.
answers.suggestion: Focus on progress instead of perfection.

answers.description: You are aware of your inner restlessness.
answers.suggestion: Practice breathing techniques to help calm your mind.

anxiety.question: When you hear the word future, what is the first word that comes to your mind?

answers.description: You experience strong anticipatory anxiety about what is coming.
answers.suggestion: Focus on the present moment and take small steps forward.

answers.description: You maintain a positive outlook even under stress.
answers.suggestion: Keep nurturing this mindset through small daily achievements.

answers.description: You feel a lack of control over what will happen next.
answers.suggestion: Make plans that depend on your own actions and decisions.

answers.description: You feel anxious about adapting to new situations.
answers.suggestion: Work on becoming more flexible by taking small steps of change.

anxiety.question: What is the first word that comes to your mind when you hear peace?

answers.description: You are searching for inner balance and calmness.
answers.suggestion: Try mindful breathing or walking without music.

answers.description: It is difficult for you to relax completely.
answers.suggestion: Practice relaxation techniques regularly.

answers.description: Your mind is seeking rest and escape.
answers.suggestion: Make sure to maintain a consistent sleep schedule and bedtime routine.

answers.description: You associate peace with being outdoors.
answers.suggestion: Spend more time outside and connect with nature.

anxiety.question: When you hear the word decision, what is the first word that comes to your mind?

answers.description: This shows uncertainty and overanalyzing.
answers.suggestion: Start making small decisions every day to build confidence.

answers.description: You are afraid of making the wrong choice.
answers.suggestion: Remind yourself that no decision is final and you can always adjust later.

answers.description: You tend to react impulsively when under pressure.
answers.suggestion: Take a short break before making important choices.

answers.description: You feel confident when your goals are clear.
answers.suggestion: Maintain focus through careful planning.

anxiety.question: When you think of the word night, what is the first word that comes to your mind?

answers.description: Your mind becomes active before sleep.
answers.suggestion: Write down your thoughts before bed to clear your mind.

answers.description: You find peace when everything is quiet.
answers.suggestion: Play soft music or meditate before sleeping.

answers.description: You have difficulty switching off at night.
answers.suggestion: Set a routine to turn off screens before bedtime.

answers.description: You feel mentally exhausted from overthinking.
answers.suggestion: Include relaxing activities in your evening routine.
